author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Corporation, which recently collected information about roadside traders and vendors through a survey under the National Urban Livelihood Mission, will issue identity cards to them on Monday (February 15).

In a statement, Commissioner S. Sivasubramanian said a survey under Union Government’s National Urban Livelihood Mission (NULM) was conducted recently with the objective of improving the living conditions of roadside traders and vendors. As the data collected from these target groups had been compiled, the beneficiary traders would soon be given identity cards with which they could avail loans from banks and even approved space for expanding their trade etc.

Those who had received acknowledgement receipt from the officials during the survey could get the identity cards from the Corporation’s Central Office on Monday (February 15) between 10 a.m. and 6 p.m. On producing the acknowledgement receipt along with two photocopies each of ration card, Electors’ Photo Identity Card and Aadhaar Card, they would be given the identity card under the NULM.

“Those who could not give details about themselves and their business during the survey, those traders and vendors may submit the required information to officials concerned at the Corporation’s Central Office for getting the identity cards,” Mr. Sivasubramanian said.
title: Identity cards for roadside traders, vendors
